for some reason I cant get the conversion tracking to work on the test in my shopify store

Let's troubleshoot your conversion tracking issue in Shopify. First, ensure that the NewsBreak Pixel is correctly installed on your Shopify store. You can follow these steps:

1. Log into your Shopify account and navigate to Online Store > Themes.
2. Identify your active theme, click Actions, and choose Edit code.
3. Find and edit the file under the Layout section (theme.liquid).
4. Paste the NewsBreak Pixel Base Code just before the </head> tag in the theme.liquid file.
5. Save the changes.

If your conversion event involves actions like adding items to the cart or making a purchase, you'll need additional tracking for those specific events.

For testing:
- Use Shopify's 'Test' feature to load the event.
- For Purchase/complete_payment events, you will need to make a purchase for the test to complete.

If you're still having trouble, please check if your tracking platform is recording clicks but not conversions. If it records conversions but not in NewsBreak, grab the click ID and timestamp from your tracking platform and email adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance.

Here's a detailed guide on installing a NewsBreak Pixel on Shopify: [How-to-install-a-NewsBreak-Pixel-on-Shopify](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18551604763405-How-to-install-a-NewsBreak-Pixel-on-Shopify)

I'm here to help with whatever you need! Let me know your question, and I'll do my best to assist you right away.
the pixel issue

To address the pixel issue, let's ensure that the NewsBreak Pixel is properly set up on your Shopify store. Here are some steps to follow:

1. **Verify Installation**: Make sure the pixel code is correctly placed in your Shopify theme's liquid file, just before the closing </head> tag.

2. **Event Tracking**: Confirm that specific events like 'Add to Cart' or 'Purchase' are being tracked. You might need to add additional event codes for these actions.

3. **Testing**: Use Shopify's test feature to simulate events and check if they are recorded.

4. **Check Clicks and Conversions**: Ensure your tracking platform records clicks and conversions accurately. If conversions aren't showing in NewsBreak, note down the click ID and timestamp from your tracking platform.

If you've followed these steps and still face issues, please email adsupport@newsbreak.com with details of your setup for further assistance.

For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [How-to-install-a-NewsBreak-Pixel-on-Shopify](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18551604763405-How-to-install-a-NewsBreak-Pixel-on-Shopify)

Hi, Iâ€™m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
testing the conversion tracking code

It seems like you're trying to test the conversion tracking code for your Shopify store. To ensure everything is set up correctly, you can follow these steps:

1. **Identify Your NewsBreak Pixel Base Code**: Log into your Ad Manager and navigate to Tools > Event Management. Choose Pixel as your tracking type, Shopify as the integration method, and specify your event type.

2. **Copy the Base Code**: Locate your base code in Step 1 and copy it.

3. **Embed the Code on Your Website**: Make sure this JavaScript code snippet is embedded on your website to collect data on specific conversion events.

4. **Test the Integration**: Once integrated, you can test it in Ad Manager or inform your account manager/operations team that the integration is complete for verification.

For more detailed instructions, you can refer to this [article](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18551604763405-How-to-install-a-NewsBreak-Pixel-on-Shopify). Let me know if you need further assistance!
i have base code works the conversion one doesnt

If your base code is working but the conversion tracking isn't, here are a few steps you can take to troubleshoot:

1. **Ensure Correct Placement**: Double-check that the conversion event code is placed correctly on the specific event page where the user action takes place.

2. **Simulate the Event**: Perform the action that should trigger the conversion pixel, such as adding an item to the cart or completing a purchase.

3. **Verify Configuration in Shopify**: Make sure that the customer event is correctly configured in Shopify and test it there as well.

4. **Test in NewsBreak**: Test the event in NewsBreak to ensure it triggers correctly.

If these steps don't resolve your issue, you might want to contact adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance. You can also refer to our [Event Tracking Debugging Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18551604763405-How-to-install-a-NewsBreak-Pixel-on-Shopify) for more detailed troubleshooting steps.

says learning process slow

It sounds like your ad campaign is in the learning phase and might be struggling to find the right audience or engagement. This can happen if the campaign had a weak start. To improve this, you can try relaunching with fresh creative or increasing your budget to give it a boost. Remember, patience is key during this phase as it typically takes about 20-30 conversions to complete. For more detailed guidance, you can check out our article on optimizing during the learning phase here: [Newsbreak Ads Overview](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/34801428495373-How-to-integrate-with-Digistore24).
hmm this is not working

I'm sorry to hear that it's not working. Could you please provide more details about what's not working? Are you facing issues with the ad campaign setup, or is there something specific in the learning phase that's causing trouble? The more information you provide, the better I can assist you!
learning phase explain

The learning phase is a crucial part of your ad campaign where the system is figuring out what works best for your ads. During this time, the algorithm gathers data to optimize performance. It typically requires about 20-30 conversions to complete this phase. If you see 'Learning Phase Slow,' it means the system is having trouble finding the right audience or engagement, often due to a weak start. To help speed up this process, consider testing new creatives or increasing your budget slightly. For more detailed information, you can refer to our article on Newsbreak Ads Overview.
well there is only 1 converion so there is no learning process

With only one conversion, your campaign hasn't gathered enough data to complete the learning phase. To help move things along, you might want to consider increasing your budget or testing new creatives to attract more engagement. Once you reach around 20-30 conversions, the system will have enough information to optimize effectively. If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!
spending a 140 per image on testing isnt learning that stuoid.. with no conversions

It sounds frustrating to spend without seeing conversions. During the testing phase, it's important to ensure your budget aligns with your CPA goals and that you're targeting the right audience. You might want to review your ad creatives and targeting settings to see if adjustments can be made. Also, consider starting with a smaller daily budget and gradually increasing it as you gather more data. If you need more detailed strategies, feel free to check out our article on maximizing conversions.

You can find detailed articles and guides on optimizing your ad campaigns in the NewsBreak Help Center. Here are a couple of useful links:

- [Maximize Conversions Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices)
- [How to Choose a Bidding Strategy](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/21344263367053-How-to-choose-a-bidding-strategy)

These resources provide insights into setting up campaigns, choosing bidding strategies, and scaling effectively. If you have any specific questions, feel free to ask!

If you're looking for a dedicated account manager, please note that this service is reserved for advertisers who meet a daily spend threshold of $1,000 or more. If you meet this requirement, you can provide documentation like a media plan or billing statement to verify your eligibility. Once verified, we can connect you with a dedicated account manager. If you're not at that level yet, our self-serve platform and support team are here to help you optimize your campaigns.
